name: general
value: The current value editor allows current value event options to be updated and viewed
(while within the event or template event list tables) or viewed only (while within the expanded
amortization or compressed cashflow tables). The current value editor is shown by pressing
the button on the right side of the "Type" column.

name: eom
value: Check this option to require that all expanded and compressed events of a base event
are adjusted to the end of the month (i.e., last day of the month) if applicable.

name: passive
value: Check this option to specify a passive current value event. A passive current value
event does not affect the balance of the cashflow. In contrast, an active current
value event does affect the balance of the cashflow.

name: present
value: Check this option to specify a Present Value (PV) current value event. A Present
Value (PV) current balance event separates the "past" from the "future" as of
a certain date.

name: general
value: The interest change editor allows interest change event options to be updated and viewed
(while within the event or template event list tables) or viewed only (while within the expanded
amortization or compressed cashflow tables). The interest change editor is shown by pressing
the button on the right side of the "Type" column.

name: interest-method
value: <div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Actuarial
<div class="col-9">
This method is used for all positive Cashflows. For negative Cashflows,
any interest that is not satisfied for a principal change event is compounded back
into the principal balance.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Simple interest
<div class="col-9">
For negative Cashflows, any interest that is not satisfied for a
principal change event is placed into a separate accrued interest balance and is usually
satisfied first with the next principal change event (unless the "principal first" option
is used). For positive Cashflows, any interest is placed into a separate accrued interest
balance and is not compounded back into the principal. If the interest method is changed
from simple interest to actuarial, any accrued interest balance is added into the principal
at that point in time for both positive and negative Cashflows.

name: day-count-basis
value: <div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Periodic
<div class="col-9">
The periodic interest rate is most often used to calculate interest with
negative Cashflows (i.e., loans, etc.) and some investments.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Rule-Of-78
<div class="col-9">
Sometimes used by financial institutions when negative Cashflows (i.e.,
loans, etc.) are to be paid off early. The theory is that more interest is paid at the
beginning of the cashflow to recoup profit or up-front costs lost by the financial
institution.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Actual/Days-In-Year
<div class="col-9">
The actual number of days divided by the number of days in the
year as defined by the "Days in year" field (e.g., money markets and mutual funds).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Actual/Actual (ISMA)
<div class="col-9">
The ISMA method of calculating an actual day count (e.g., U.S.
Treasury bonds and notes).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Actual/Actual (AFB)
<div class="col-9">
The AFB method of calculating an actual day count (e.g., U.S.
Treasury bonds and notes).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
Actual/365L (ISDA)
<div class="col-9">
The ISDA method of calculating an actual day count (e.g., bonds
that take leap years into account).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
30/Days-In-Year
<div class="col-9">
A 30-day based calculation divided by the number of days in
the year as defined by the "Days in year" field (e.g., U.S. agency bonds, municipal
bonds, corporate bonds, mortgage backed securities, etc.).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
30E/Days-In-Year
<div class="col-9">
A 30-day based calculation divided by the number of days in
the year as defined by the "Days in year" field (e.g., Euro bonds).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
30E+/Days-In-Year
<div class="col-9">
A 30-day based calculation divided by the number of days in
the year as defined by the "Days in year" field (e.g., Swiss bonds).

name: days-in-year
value: The declared number of days in the year that is used for particular day counts.

name: effective-frequency
value: Adjusts the compounding period as set by the Frequency
column of the interest change event, thus changing the effective annual rate. For example,
Canadian loans often mandate a 6-month effective frequency while maintaining monthly
payments. This would usually result in 5 payments with no interest and 1 payment with
an interest amount that is too large to be covered by the 6th payment (thus compounding
the unpaid interest back into the principal balance). By specifying 6-month in this
field, the large interest amount normally accrued on the 6th payment is prorated
over all 6 payments while maintaining the required effective annual rate.

name: interest-frequency
value: Since the Frequency column of interest change events
are used to specify the compounding period, this field can be optionally used with
the Periods and Intervals columns to allow interest change events to be repeated
on a periodic basis (or a non-periodic basis with active skip periods), thus allowing
"stepped" interest events, etc.

name: round-balance
value: <div>Each interest amount is rounded according to all values of round decimal digits. This
option is usually set to None for the actuarial method and is sometimes set to bankers
for the actuarial and simple interest methods.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
none
<div class="col-9">
Do not round interest amounts.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
bankers
<div class="col-9">
Exact rounding using banker's method (at .5 round to even number).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
bias-up
<div class="col-9">
Exact rounding with bias up (at .5 round up).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
bias-down
<div class="col-9">
Exact rounding with bias down (at .5 round down).
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
up
<div class="col-9">
Any decimal digits round up.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
truncate
<div class="col-9">
Truncate decimal digits.

name: round-decimal-digits
value: A value less than zero (< 0) indicates that the decimal digits
specified in the user preferences should be used. A value greater than zero and less than
one (0 < x < 1) indicates that rounding is performed according to the fraction x. A value
equal to zero or greater than or equal to one (0 or >= 1) indicates an explicit integer number
of decimal digits to perform rounding.

name: nominal-annual-rate
value: The nominal annual rate as defined by the Value column
of this interest change event. If this value is updated, the Value column will also
be changed. Any changes to this field will be reflected in all rate fields of this
dialog.

name: effective-annual-rate
value: The effective annual rate will be the same as the
nominal annual rate when the compounding period is 1-year. However, when the
compounding period is less than 1-year (e.g., 1-month, etc.), the effective
annual rate will be slightly greater than the nominal annual rate due to compounding
occuring more frequently. Any changes to this field will be reflected in all
rate fields of this dialog.

name: periodic-rate
value: The periodic rate is the interest rate that will
be used for each compounding period when the day count basis is set to Periodic
(except when a "stub" or odd days period is seen, in which case the daily rate
is used). Any changes to this field will be reflected in all rate fields of this dialog.

name: daily-rate
value: The daily rate is the interest rate that will
be used when the day count basis is set to Actual/Days-In-Year (all other day
count basis options use industry standard formulas) or when the Periodic day count
basis is used and a "stub" or odd days period is seen. Any changes to this field
will be reflected in all rate fields of this dialog.

name: general
value: The principal change editor allows principal change event options to be updated and viewed
(while within the event or template event list tables) or viewed only (while within the expanded
amortization or compressed cashflow tables). The principal change editor is shown by pressing
the button on the right side of the "Type" column.

name: principal-type
value: The type of principal change event.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
decrease
<div class="col-9">
Decrease the principal balance.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
increase
<div class="col-9">
Increase the principal balance.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
negative
<div class="col-9">
Set the principal balance to a negative value.
<div class="row mt-2">
<div class="col-3">
positive
<div class="col-9">
Set the principal balance to a positive value.

name: eom
value: Check this option to require that all expanded and compressed
events of a base event are adjusted to the end of the month (i.e., last day of the month) if
applicable. For example, some contracts explicitly state that principal change events (such
as payments for loans) must come on the 30th of the month unless the number of days in the
month is less, while other contracts explicitly state that principal change events must come
on the last day of the month.

name: principal-first
value: For negative Cashflows (i.e., loans, etc.) operating under
the "Simple interest" method, check this option to force the entire amount of the principal
change value to be applied to the principal balance first (thus allowing interest to be
accrued in the meantime). This will change the balance of the cashflow since any interest
accrued is only satisfied after the entire principal balance is satisfied.

name: statictics
value: Check this option for any principal change event that
should be assigned a "Sequence" column incrementing value and also be counted in the
principal change balance statistics (usually shown within the status line).

name: auxiliary
value: Check this option if the principal change event is
an active auxiliary event and does affect the balance of the cashflow. An example
would be prepaid interest paid on a loan.

name: passive
value: This option can only be checked if the "Auxiliary event"
option above is first checked. Check this option if the principal change event is
a passive auxiliary event and does not affect the balance of the cashflow, even
though it is displayed within the cashflow. Examples would be "Points" paid on a
loan or any type of fee incurred while originating or servicing the cashflow. Note:
The overall yield (i.e., APR) calculation will factor in passive auxiliary principal
change events, so that an overall interest rate can be correctly reported.

name: general
value: The statistic value editor allows statistic value event options to be updated and viewed
(while within the event or template event list tables) or viewed only (while within the expanded
amortization or compressed cashflow tables). The statistic value editor is shown by pressing
the button on the right side of the "Type" column.

name: name
value: A short unique name that normally appears in the "Type" column
for the event. If a uniquely identifying name is not assigned to the statistic event, a name is
automatically assigned when the statistic event is created. When a name is used that is already
active, the current statistic value event is discontinued and the new statistic value event is
started (unless the "Final statistic" option is checked).

name: eom
value: Check this option to require that all expanded and compressed
events of a base event are adjusted to the end of the month (i.e., last day of the month)
if applicable.

name: final
value: When checked, prematurely discontinues the statistic event
with the corresponding name shown in the Name field. (Note: Statistic value events normally
run in perpetuity until the end of the cashflow.)

name: general
value: <div>The skip periods editor has a slider bar and a table, which shows the skip periods
entries selected with the slider bar.
<div>The slider bar specifies the number of skip period entries that will be displayed
in the table up to and including the number of periods specified in the Periods column
of this event.
<div>The skip period entries indicate which periods to allow and which periods to skip for
the event. If the number of skip period entries is less than the number of periods, the
entries are simply repeated until the number of periods is satisfied for this event. Skip
periods can also be used with interest change events to handle non-periodic interest rate
adjustments, all from a single event.
<div>For example, with a loan for a seasonal business, we could easy create 3 principal
change events, each having a periods value of 120 months (i.e., 10 years) and 12 skip
period entries (i.e., 1 year), in order to adjust for 3 different payment amounts during
specific months of each year for the life of the loan.
<div>Within the table are shown the skip periods entries. Each skip periods entry can be
either True, indicating that the period is to be skipped, or False, indicating that the
period is not to be skipped. By clicking the checkbox for the skip period entries,
each skip period is either skipped (True) or not skipped (False).

name: date
value: The date of the skip period as determined by
the start date, intervals and frequency of the event. Since skip period
entries are repeated until the number of periods in the event are satisfied,
this date represents only the first date that a skip period entry is used.

name: skip-period
value: A checkbox indicating if the period is to be skipped
(i.e., checked or True) or not skipped (i.e., unchecked or False)

name: general
value: The descriptor editor has a table, which shows one or more descriptors
that comprise the descriptor list, and a New and Delete button. The New button
creates a new descriptor into the descriptor list while the Delete button deletes
the selected descriptor from the descriptor list.

name: group
value: The group identifier of the descriptor. A number
of descriptors that are used with customization have pre-defined group identifiers. All
other types of descriptors may use any group identifier except those that are
pre-defined. The associated button with this column displays the pre-defined identifiers
for the user, template, and cashflow descriptor lists.

name: name
value: The name identifier of the descriptor within the selected
group. A number of descriptors that are used with customization have pre-defined name
identifiers within the selected group. All other types of descriptors may use any name
identifier except those that are pre-defined within the selected group. The associated
button with this column displays the pre-defined identifiers within the selected group for
the user, template, and cashflow descriptor lists.

name: type
value: The type of the descriptor, which may be the pre-defined
identifier "locale", for a locale sensitive descriptor, or anything else that has
meaning to the user or installation (e.g., "GLCode", "TaxCode", etc.).

name: code
value: The code of the descriptor, which must be a valid locale
(if the type has been set to "locale") or anything else that has meaning to the user
or installation (e.g., a general ledger code, tax code, etc.).

name: value
value: The actual value of the descriptor. When employing one
of the pre-defined customization descriptors at the user, template or cashflow levels,
the associated button will invoke one of the customization editors to assist in defining
the descriptor's value. This column is read-only for pre-defined customization descriptors
(i.e., the customization editor must be used to change the value) and read-write for all
other types of descriptors.

name: value-expr
value: When this column is not blank for a particular descriptor,
the expression is evaluated (at the appropriate point in time) and the result is set into
the Value column field. The associated button invokes the expression editor to assist in
creating the expression.

name: propagate
value: Copy this descriptor to the next level down if applicable.
This option is primarily used with a user level descriptor list to allow individual
descriptors to be copied either to a newly created template or a cashflow that is not
based upon a template. All template descriptors (both preference descriptors and event
descriptors) are always copied to a newly created cashflow regardless of the setting
of this field (otherwise they would have no useful purpose).

name: general
value: The parameters editor shows a table, which contains one or more parameters
that comprise the parameter list, and New and Delete buttons. The New button
creates a new parameter into the parameter list while the Delete button deletes
the selected parameter from the parameter list.

name: name
value: The name of the parameter, which may be
subsequently used within expressions at the current level of evaluation (i.e.,
user, cashflow or event list). The name of the parameter must not include
space characters.

name: type
value: The type of the parameter, which must be either an
integer (for dates or whole numbers), decimal (for floating point values) or
string (for textual information).

name: value
value: The value of the parameter which must be of the
resulting type set by the column "Type". This is the only column that is normally
filled in by the end-user (i.e., all other columns are usually determined by
the template author).

name: general
value: The preferences editor allows the user preferences to be shown and the cashflow preferences
to be shown and selectively edited.

name: locale-str
value: A locale designates the language, country
and an optional variant (such as "EURO") separated by underscore
characters ("_"). This value is selected from the accompanying
combo box list. In addition to a spoken language, a locale helps determine
the proper date, currency and number formats for formatting purposes.

name: group
value: This preference sets the template
group that is assigned to a cashflow. The template group is eventually
propagated to an individual cashflow from either the user or template
preferences.

name: cross-rate-code
value: When this value is set to an international
currency code, a cross rate exchange rate can be utilized if a direct
exchange rate is not available. The use of a cross rate code may result
in a slightly greater margin of error than a direct exchange rate. If this
value is not set, only a direct exchange rate will be performed.

name: encoding
value: The encoding type that is used to create
JSON files. A value of "utf-8" is the default and is usually sufficient
for most JSON files.

name: fiscal-year-start
value: A date which determines the start of
the fiscal year. This is primarily applicable to statistic events.
Only the month and day portions of the date are used (i.e., the year
portion of the date is ignored). The default value is January 1.

name: decimal-digits
value: This preference determines the number
of decimal digits (i.e., digits to the right of the decimal point) that
are shown for currency values. The default value for decimal digits is 2.
This value does not affect calculations unless explicit rounding of
intermediate interest values are requested.

name: target-value
value: The target value used for investment calculations. For loans, this value is
normally zero (default).

name: combine-principal
value: When set, this preference will combine
principal value fields during normalization of expanded events (i.e.,
prior to balancing). Principal value fields will only be combined if the
principal change events have the same date and other applicable values.
Parameter and descriptor lists are merged if they are different and this
preference is set. The default value (if not set) is Set.

name: compress-descriptor
value: When set, this preference will merge
descriptor lists into a single descriptor list during compression of
expanded events (i.e., after balancing). Contiguous events will only be
compressed into a single event if their values are equal except the date,
which must be exactly 1 period length greater than the previous event.
Events are still compressed if their descriptor lists are different and
this preference is set. The default value (if not set) is Reset.

name: statistic-events
value: When set, any statistic events seen are omitted from the
compressed cashflow. The default value (if not set) is Set.

name: general
value: General help #####.

name: general
value: General help #####.

name: general
value: General help #####.

name: general
value: General help #####.

name: general
value: General help #####.
